reviews.review_msg: Course specifically focused on Indigenous Health. Dr. Kelm is very caring and reasonable with her grading. Some criteria are vague, but if clarifications are needed, Dr. Kelm was more than happy to answer e-mails/office hours/talk after class. Primarily had to do research projects but had enough time to do them. She gave good advice along the way.

Caring and informative professor, Dr. Kelm is great for those willing to engage in class. Criteria for grading can be vague at times, but she makes it up with her support and clarification in office hours. Accommodating to extensions if needed. Few assignments, participation in seminar is important to get high grades
Dr. May is a great professor and does amazing lectures and seminars.
Good professor, good talks and easy on grade.

Professor Spear is encouraging of students to share their own thoughts about materials in discussions. She is a fair marker and gives good feedback. She assigns a variety of interesting readings and is thoughtful about what students can learn from them. Her expectations are fair.
